newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX Hub natgas called mostly flat amid firm cash.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX Hub natgas called mostly flat amid firm cash.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures were expected to open unchanged to slightly higher Wednesday amid early talk of firm cash prices, industry sources said.
Range-bound May over-the-counter trade ranged from $1.94 to $1.95 after settling Tuesday at $1.937 per million British thermal units.
In ACCESS, May last traded 0.2 cent lower at $1.94.
Early cash prices at the Henry Hub, La., were talked at $1.99-2.04, while deals were reported done on Transco (Station 65) as high as $2.08 per mmBtu.
Traders said support in May was at $1.92, and then at $1.88, $1.85 and $1.825. Resistance was seen at $1.975, $1.99, $2.05 and $2.095.
Estimates for today's American Gas Association storage report ranged from a draw of 40 bcf to a build of 13 bcf.

In Tuesday's cash market, Gulf Coast prices were steady in the high-$1.90s. Midcontinent pipes also were flat to one cent lower at $1.84-1.86. Gas at the New York city gate was talked several cents softer at $2.35.
Temperatures throughout most of the East and upper Midwest are expected to remain below normal through week's end.
